intro: Sclerocaryopsis ceratophora, commonly known as the horned seedpod plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like seed pods that encase its seeds. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are often small and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are usually small and clustered, contributing to its overall ecological role in its native habitat.
